00021 import logging, os, string, sys
00022 import pyp_db
00023 import pyp_io
00024 import pyp_nrm

00026 import pyp_network
00027 import networkx

00030 from reportlab.lib.units import inch, cm
00031 from reportlab.pdfgen import canvas
00032 
00033 global metric_to_column
00034 global byvar_to_column
00035 
00036 metric_to_column = {'fa':'coi'}
00037 byvar_to_column = {'by':'birthyear',
00038                   'gen':'generation'}
00039 
00040 ##
00041 # meanMetricBy() returns a dictionary of means keyed by levels of the 'byvar' that
00042 # can be used to draw graphs or prepare reports of summary statistics.
00043 # @param pedobj A PyPedal pedigree object.
00044 # @param metric The variable to summarize on a BY variable.
00045 # @param byvar The variable on which to group the metric.
00046 # @param createpdf Flag indicating whether or not a PDF version of the report should be created.
00047 # @param conn Handle to a database connection, or False.
00048 # @retval A dictionary containing means for the metric variable keyed to levels of the byvar.
00049 def meanMetricBy(pedobj, metric='fa', byvar='by', createpdf=False, conn=False):
00050     """
00051     meanMetricBy() returns a dictionary of means keyed by levels of the 'byvar' that
00052     can be used to draw graphs or prepare reports of summary statistics.
00053     """
00054     # If the user doesn't pass us a db_dict then try and connect to the database
00055     conn_created = False
00056     result_dict = {}
00057     if conn == False:
00058         conn = pyp_db.connectToDatabase(pedobj)
00059         conn_created = True
00060     try:
00061         if metric not in ['fa']:
00062             logging.warning('You passed an unrecognized variable, %s, to pyp_reports/animalMetricBy() in the METRIC field.  It has been changed to \'fa\' (coefficient of inbreeding).', metric)
00063             metric = 'fa'
00064         if byvar not in ['gen','sex','birthyear','by']:
00065             logging.warning('You passed an unrecognized variable, %s, to pyp_reports/animalMetricBy() in the BYVAR field.  It has been changed to \'by\' (birth year).', byvar)
00066             byvar = 'by'
00067 
00068         if pyp_db.doesTableExist(pedobj, conn=conn):
00069             sql = 'select %s, avg(%s) from %s group by %s order by %s' % ( byvar_to_column[byvar], \
00070                 metric_to_column[metric], pedobj.kw['database_table'], byvar_to_column[byvar], \
00071                 byvar_to_column[byvar] )
00072             #print sql
00073             cursor = conn.Execute(sql)
00074             while not cursor.EOF:
00075                 result_dict[cursor.fields[0]] = cursor.fields[1]
00076                 cursor.MoveNext()
00077             cursor.Close()
00078             logging.info('pyp_reports/meanMetricBy() report completed.')
00079         else:
00080             logging.error('pyp_reports/meanMetricBy() report failed!')
00081         if conn_created:
00082             conn.Close()
00083 
00084         if createpdf:
00085             try:
00086                 mmbPdfTitle = '%s_mean_metric_%s_%s' % \
00087                     (pedobj.kw['default_report'], metric, byvar)
00088                 _mmbPdf = pdfMeanMetricBy(pedobj, result_dict, 1, mmbPdfTitle)
00089                 if _mmbPdf:
00090                     logging.info('pyp_reports/pdfMeanMetricBy() succeeded.')
00091                 else:
00092                     logging.error('pyp_reports/pdfMeanMetricBy() failed.')
00093             except:
00094                 pass
00095     except:
00096         pass
00097     return result_dict
00098 
00099 ##
00100 # pdfMeanMetricBy() returns a dictionary of means keyed by levels of the 'byvar' that
00101 # can be used to draw graphs or prepare reports of summary statistics.
00102 # @param pedobj A PyPedal pedigree object.
00103 # @param results A dictionary containing means for the metric variable keyed to levels of the byvar.
00104 # @param titlepage Show (1) or hide (0) the title page.
00105 # @param reporttitle Title of report; if '', _pdfTitle is used.
00106 # @param reportauthor Author/preparer of report.
00107 # @param reportfile Optional name of file to which the report should be written.
00108 # @retval 1 on success, 0 on failure
00109 def pdfMeanMetricBy(pedobj, results, titlepage=0, reporttitle='', reportauthor='', reportfile=''):
00110     """
00111     pdfMeanMetricBy() returns a dictionary of means keyed by levels of the 'byvar' that
00112     can be used to draw graphs or prepare reports of summary statistics.
00113     """
00114     try:
00115         import reportlab
00116     except ImportError:
00117         logging.error('Unable to import ReportLab in pyp_reports/pdfMeanMetricBy().')
00118         return 0
00119 
00120     try:
00121         if reportfile == '':
00122             _pdfOutfile = '%s_mean_metric_by.pdf' % ( pedobj.kw['default_report'] )
00123         else:
00124             _pdfOutfile = reportfile
00125         if pedobj.kw['messages'] == 'verbose':
00126             print 'Writing meanMetricBy report to %s' % ( _pdfOutfile )
00127         logging.info('Writing meanMetricBy report to %s', _pdfOutfile )
00128 
00129         _pdfSettings = _pdfInitialize(pedobj)
00130         canv = canvas.Canvas(_pdfOutfile, invariant=1)
00131         canv.setPageCompression(1)
00132 
00133         if titlepage:
00134             if reporttitle == '':
00135                 reporttitle = 'meanMetricBy Report for Pedigree\n%s' % (pedobj.kw['pedname'])
00136             _pdfCreateTitlePage(canv, _pdfSettings, reporttitle, reportauthor)
00137         _pdfDrawPageFrame(canv, _pdfSettings)
00138 
00139         canv.setFont("Times-Bold", 12)
00140         tx = canv.beginText( _pdfSettings['_pdfCalcs']['_left_margin'],
00141             _pdfSettings['_pdfCalcs']['_top_margin'] - 0.5 * _pdfSettings['_pdfCalcs']['_unit'] )
00142         # This is where the actual content is written to a text object that will be displayed on
00143         # a canvas.
00144         for _k, _v in results.iteritems():
00145             if len(str(_k)) <= 14:
00146                 _line = '\t%s:\t\t%s' % (_k, _v)
00147             else:
00148                 _line = '\t%s:\t%s' % (_k, _v)
00149             tx.textLine(_line)
00150             if tx.getY() < _pdfSettings['_pdfCalcs']['_bottom_margin'] + \
00151                 0.5 * _pdfSettings['_pdfCalcs']['_unit']:
00152                 canv.drawText(tx)
00153                 canv.showPage()
00154                 _pdfDrawPageFrame(canv, _pdfSettings)
00155                 canv.setFont('Times-Roman', 12)
00156                 tx = canv.beginText( _pdfSettings['_pdfCalcs']['_left_margin'],
00157                     _pdfSettings['_pdfCalcs']['_top_margin'] -
00158                     0.5 * _pdfSettings['_pdfCalcs']['_unit'] )
00159         if tx:
00160             canv.drawText(tx)
00161             canv.showPage()
00162         canv.save()
00163         return 1
00164     except:
00165         return 0
00166 
00167 ##
00168 # pdfPedigreeMetadata() produces a report, in PDF format, of the metadata from
00169 # the input pedigree.  It is intended for use as a template for custom printed
00170 # reports.
00171 # @param pedobj A PyPedal pedigree object.
00172 # @param titlepage Show (1) or hide (0) the title page.
00173 # @param reporttitle Title of report; if '', _pdfTitle is used.
00174 # @param reportauthor Author/preparer of report.
00175 # @param reportfile Optional name of file to which the report should be written.
00176 # @retval A 1 on success, 0 otherwise.
00177 def pdfPedigreeMetadata(pedobj, titlepage=0, reporttitle='', reportauthor='', reportfile=''):
00178     """
00179     pdfPedigreeMetadata() produces a report, in PDF format, of the metadata from
00180     the input pedigree.  It is intended for use as a template for custom printed
00181     reports.
00182     """
00183     try:
00184         import reportlab
00185     except ImportError:
00186         logging.error('Unable to import ReportLab in pyp_reports/pdfPedigreeMetadata().')
00187         return 0
00188 
00189     if reportfile == '':
00190         _pdfOutfile = '%s_metadata.pdf' % ( pedobj.kw['default_report'] )
00191     else:
00192         _pdfOutfile = reportfile
00193     if pedobj.kw['messages'] == 'verbose':
00194         print 'Writing metadata report to %s' % ( _pdfOutfile )
00195     logging.info('Writing metadata report to %s', _pdfOutfile )
00196 
00197     # The _pdfSettings dictionary contains several settings, such as page size,
00198     # page height and width, and margins, that are used several times.
00199     _pdfSettings = _pdfInitialize(pedobj)
00200 
00201     # The actual report is written to an instance of a canvas object, which is
00202     # stored in a file whose name is _pdfOutfile.  We have to create this canvas
00203     # before we can start assembling our report.
00204     canv = canvas.Canvas(_pdfOutfile, invariant=1)
00205     canv.setPageCompression(1)
00206 
00207     # Add a title page to the report if the user wants one.
00208     if titlepage:
00209         if reporttitle == '':
00210             reporttitle = 'Metadata for Pedigree\n%s' % (pedobj.kw['pedname'])
00211         _pdfCreateTitlePage(canv, _pdfSettings, reporttitle, reportauthor)
00212 
00213     # Start a new page of output.  Split the metadata output returned by the
00214     # stringme() method on linebreak characters and write each of the resulting
00215     # tokens to the canvas.
00216     _pdfDrawPageFrame(canv, _pdfSettings)
00217     canv.setFont("Times-Bold", 12)
00218     tx = canv.beginText( _pdfSettings['_pdfCalcs']['_left_margin'],
00219         _pdfSettings['_pdfCalcs']['_top_margin'] - 0.5 * _pdfSettings['_pdfCalcs']['_unit'] )
00220     _metadata_string = string.split(pedobj.metadata.stringme(), '\n')
00221     for _m in _metadata_string:
00222         tx.textLine(_m)
00223         # Page breaking has to be done manually.  Oh, well, I was able to steal, er,
00224         # borrow this but from odyssey.py.
00225         if tx.getY() < _pdfSettings['_pdfCalcs']['_bottom_margin'] + \
00226             0.5 * _pdfSettings['_pdfCalcs']['_unit']:
00227             canv.drawText(tx)
00228             canv.showPage()
00229             _pdfDrawPageFrame(canv, _pdfSettings)
00230             canv.setFont('Times-Roman', 12)
00231             tx = canv.beginText( _pdfSettings['_pdfCalcs']['_left_margin'],
00232                 _pdfSettings['_pdfCalcs']['_top_margin'] -
00233                 0.5 * _pdfSettings['_pdfCalcs']['_unit'] )
00234 
00235             pg = canv.getPageNumber()
00236             if pedobj.kw['messages'] == 'verbose' and pg % 10 == 0:
00237                 print 'Printed page %d' % pg
00238 
00239     # Finish the document.  You need to draw the text object to the canvas and
00240     # call the showPage() method on the canvas so that your changes are visible.
00241     if tx:
00242         canv.drawText(tx)
00243         canv.showPage()
00244         # The following line inserts a blank page.  It was in the odyssey.py
00245         # example distributed with ReportLab, but I'm not sure why.  If the
00246         # last page of your document is getting chopped off try uncommenting
00247         # this line.
00248         #_pdfDrawPageFrame(canv, _pdfSettings)
00249 
00250     # Once your report has been assembled it must be written to disc.  If you
00251     # omit the 'canv.save()' line then your PDF will never be written to a file.
00252     canv.save()
00253 
00254 ##
00255 # pdf3GenPed() draws a three-generation pedigree for animal 'animalID'.
00256 # @param animalID An animal ID or list of animal IDs.
00257 # @param pedobj A PyPedal pedigree object.
00258 # @param titlepage Show (1) or hide (0) the title page.
00259 # @param reporttitle Title of report; if '', _pdfTitle is used.
00260 # @param reportauthor Author/preparer of report.
00261 # @param reportfile Optional name of file to which the report should be written.
00262 # @retval 1 on success, 0 on failure
00263 def pdf3GenPed(animalID, pedobj, titlepage=0, reporttitle='', reportauthor='', reportfile=''):
00264     """
00265     pdf3GenPed() draws a three-generation pedigree for animal 'animalID'.
00266     """
00267 
00268     try:
00269         import reportlab
00270     except ImportError:
00271         logging.error('Unable to import ReportLab in pyp_reports/pdf3GenPed().')
00272         return 0
00273 
00274     # If the user specified only a single ID as an integer
00275     # we need to put it in a list.
00276     if type(animalID) != list:
00277         animalID = [animalID]
00278 
00279     if reportfile == '':
00280         _pdfOutfile = 'three_generation_pedigrees.pdf'
00281     else:
00282         _pdfOutfile = reportfile
00283     if pedobj.kw['messages'] == 'verbose':
00284         print 'Writing 3GenPed to %s' % ( _pdfOutfile )
00285     logging.info('Writing 3GenPed to %s', _pdfOutfile )
00286 
00287     _pdfSettings = _pdfInitialize(pedobj)
00288     #print _pdfSettings
00289     canv = canvas.Canvas(_pdfOutfile, invariant=1)
00290     canv.setPageCompression(1)
00291 
00292     if titlepage:
00293         if reporttitle == '':
00294             reporttitle = 'Three-generation Pedigrees'
00295         _pdfCreateTitlePage(canv, _pdfSettings, reporttitle, reportauthor)
00296         _pdfDrawPageFrame(canv, _pdfSettings)
00297 
00298     # This is where the actual content is written to a text object
00299     # that will be displayed on a canvas.
00300     try:
00301         for _anid in animalID:
00302             # Each pedigree is on a separate page, and page settings do
00303             # not persist across pages.
00304             canv.setFont("Times-Bold", 12)
00305             tx = canv.beginText( _pdfSettings['_pdfCalcs']['_left_margin'],
00306             _pdfSettings['_pdfCalcs']['_top_margin'] - 0.5 * \
00307                 _pdfSettings['_pdfCalcs']['_unit'] )
00308             _pdfDrawPageFrame(canv, _pdfSettings)
00309             # We need to know the animal's renumbered ID. If the pedigree
00310             # we are using was based on animal names rather than integral
00311             # IDs we need to map the name back to the correct renumbered
00312             # ID.
00313             if 'A' in pedobj.kw['pedformat']:
00314                 _anidx = pedobj.idmap[pedobj.namemap[_anid]] - 1
00315                 _anid = pedobj.backmap[pedobj.idmap[pedobj.namemap[_anid]]]
00316             else:
00317                 _anidx = pedobj.idmap[_anid] - 1
00318             # Oh, sure, it's ugly and inelegant and not easily extensible,
00319             # but it gets the job done. There are 15 possible animals
00320             # in a three-generation pedigree, and with the data structures
00321             # I'm using it's easiest to just populate the dictionary by
00322             # hand.
00323             _places = {}
00324             _places['a'] = pedobj.idmap[_anid]
00325             # Go down the sire side of the pedigree
00326             _places['s'] = pedobj.pedigree[_places['a']-1].sireID
00327             if int(_places['s']) != pedobj.kw['missing_parent']:
00328                 _places['ss'] = pedobj.pedigree[_places['s']-1].sireID
00329                 _places['sd'] = pedobj.pedigree[_places['s']-1].damID
00330             else:
00331                 _places['ss'] = pedobj.kw['missing_parent']
00332                 _places['sd'] = pedobj.kw['missing_parent']
00333             if int(_places['ss']) != pedobj.kw['missing_parent']:
00334                 _places['sss'] = pedobj.pedigree[_places['ss']-1].sireID
00335                 _places['ssd'] = pedobj.pedigree[_places['ss']-1].damID
00336             else:
00337                 _places['sss'] = pedobj.kw['missing_parent']
00338                 _places['ssd'] = pedobj.kw['missing_parent']
00339             if int(_places['sd']) != pedobj.kw['missing_parent']:
00340                 _places['sds'] = pedobj.pedigree[_places['sd']-1].sireID
00341                 _places['sdd'] = pedobj.pedigree[_places['sd']-1].damID
00342             else:
00343                 _places['sds'] = pedobj.kw['missing_parent']
00344                 _places['sdd'] = pedobj.kw['missing_parent']
00345             # Go down the dam side of the pedigree
00346             _places['d'] = pedobj.pedigree[_places['a']-1].damID
00347             if _places['d'] != pedobj.kw['missing_parent']:
00348                 _places['ds'] = pedobj.pedigree[_places['d']-1].sireID
00349                 _places['dd'] = pedobj.pedigree[_places['d']-1].damID
00350             else:
00351                 _places['ds'] = pedobj.kw['missing_parent']
00352                 _places['dd'] = pedobj.kw['missing_parent']
00353             if _places['ds'] != pedobj.kw['missing_parent']:
00354                 _places['dss'] = pedobj.pedigree[_places['ds']-1].sireID
00355                 _places['dsd'] = pedobj.pedigree[_places['ds']-1].damID
00356             else:
00357                 _places['dss'] = pedobj.kw['missing_parent']
00358                 _places['dsd'] = pedobj.kw['missing_parent']
00359             if _places['dd'] != pedobj.kw['missing_parent']:
00360                 _places['dds'] = pedobj.pedigree[_places['dd']-1].sireID
00361                 _places['ddd'] = pedobj.pedigree[_places['dd']-1].damID
00362             else:
00363                 _places['dds'] = pedobj.kw['missing_parent']
00364                 _places['ddd'] = pedobj.kw['missing_parent']
00365             #for k,v in _places.iteritems():
00366             #        print k,v
00367 
00368             _sill_width = _pdfSettings['_pdfCalcs']['_frame_width'] * 0.25
00369             _16 = _pdfSettings['_pdfCalcs']['_frame_height'] / 16.
00370             _64 = _pdfSettings['_pdfCalcs']['_frame_height'] / 64.
00371             _x = _pdfSettings['_pdfCalcs']['_left_margin']
00372             _y = _pdfSettings['_pdfCalcs']['_bottom_margin']
00373 
00374             # We're going to use a lookup table to store the x and y
00375             # coordinates for drawing sills. This will allow us to use
00376             # a single loop to populate the pedigree.
00377             os = {}
00378             for k in _places.keys(): os[k] = {}
00379             os['a']['x'] = _x; os['a']['y'] = _y+(8*_16)
00380             os['d']['x'] = _x+_sill_width; os['d']['y'] = _y+(4*_16)
00381             os['s']['x'] = _x+_sill_width; os['s']['y'] = _y+(12*_16)
00382             os['dd']['x'] = _x+(2*_sill_width); os['dd']['y'] = _y+(2*_16)
00383             os['ds']['x'] = _x+(2*_sill_width); os['ds']['y'] = _y+(6*_16)
00384             os['sd']['x'] = _x+(2*_sill_width); os['sd']['y'] = _y+(10*_16)
00385             os['ss']['x'] = _x+(2*_sill_width); os['ss']['y'] = _y+(14*_16)
00386             os['ddd']['x'] = _x+(3*_sill_width); os['ddd']['y'] = _y+(1*_16)
00387             os['dds']['x'] = _x+(3*_sill_width); os['dds']['y'] = _y+(3*_16)
00388             os['dsd']['x'] = _x+(3*_sill_width); os['dsd']['y'] = _y+(5*_16)
00389             os['dss']['x'] = _x+(3*_sill_width); os['dss']['y'] = _y+(7*_16)
00390             os['sdd']['x'] = _x+(3*_sill_width); os['sdd']['y'] = _y+(9*_16)
00391             os['sds']['x'] = _x+(3*_sill_width); os['sds']['y'] = _y+(11*_16)
00392             os['ssd']['x'] = _x+(3*_sill_width); os['ssd']['y'] = _y+(13*_16)
00393             os['sss']['x'] = _x+(3*_sill_width); os['sss']['y'] = _y+(15*_16)
00394 
00395             _line = 'Pedigree for %s (%s)' % ( pedobj.pedigree[_anidx].name, \
00396                 pedobj.pedigree[_anidx].originalID )
00397             canv.setFont("Times-Bold", 12)
00398             canv.drawString( _x, _pdfSettings['_pdfCalcs']['_top_margin']-0.25*_16, _line )
00399             canv.setLineWidth(1)
00400             # Remember that the sills (and labels) are drawn from
00401             # bottom-to-top. The "+2" fudge factor in the drawString()
00402             # calls for _sill_text_1 is there so that the text sits a
00403             # hair above the bracket lines; it looks better that way.
00404             for k in _places.keys():
00405                 canv.line( os[k]['x'], os[k]['y'], os[k]['x']+_sill_width, os[k]['y'] )
00406                 if _places[k] == pedobj.kw['missing_parent']:
00407                     _sill_text_1 = '(%s)' % ( 'Unknown Parent' )
00408                     _sill_text_2 = ''
00409                 else:
00410                     _sill_text_1 = '%s' % ( pedobj.pedigree[_places[k]-1].name )
00411                     _sill_text_2 = '(%s)' % ( pedobj.pedigree[_places[k]-1].originalID )
00412                 canv.setFont("Times-Bold", 12)
00413                 canv.drawString( os[k]['x'], os[k]['y']+2, _sill_text_1 )
00414                 canv.setFont("Times-Roman", 12)
00415                 canv.drawString( os[k]['x'], os[k]['y']-_64, _sill_text_2 )
00416                 if k == 'a':
00417                     canv.setFont("Times-Roman", 12)
00418                     if pedobj.pedigree[_places[k]-1].herd == 'u':
00419                         _herd = '%s' % ( pedobj.kw['missing_herd'] )
00420                     else:
00421                         _herd = '%s' % ( pedobj.pedigree[_places[k]-1].herd )
00422                     _breed = '%s' % ( pedobj.pedigree[_places[k]-1].breed )
00423                     _inbreed = '%s' % ( pedobj.pedigree[_places[k]-1].fa )
00424                     _pedcomp = '%5.3f' % ( pedobj.pedigree[_places[k]-1].pedcomp )
00425                     canv.drawString( _x, _y+0.25*_16, 'Pedigree completeness:' )
00426                     canv.drawString( _x+_sill_width, _y+0.25*_16, _pedcomp )
00427                     canv.drawString( _x, _y+0.5*_16, 'Inbreeding:' )
00428                     canv.drawString( _x+_sill_width, _y+0.5*_16, _inbreed )
00429                     canv.drawString( _x, _y+0.75*_16, 'Breed:' )
00430                     canv.drawString( _x+_sill_width, _y+0.75*_16, _breed )
00431                     canv.drawString( _x, _y+_16, 'Herd:' )
00432                     canv.drawString( _x+_sill_width, _y+_16, _herd )
00433             # Draw the vertical lines that join the sills.
00434             ## Parents
00435             canv.line( os['s']['x'],os['d']['y'],os['s']['x'],os['s']['y'] )
00436             ## Maternal grandparents
00437             canv.line( os['ds']['x'],os['dd']['y'],os['ds']['x'],os['ds']['y'] )
00438             ## Paternal grandparents
00439             canv.line( os['ss']['x'],os['sd']['y'],os['ss']['x'],os['ss']['y'] )
00440             ## Mat-mat grandparents
00441             canv.line( os['dds']['x'],os['ddd']['y'],os['dds']['x'],os['dds']['y'] )
00442             ## Mat-pat grandparents
00443             canv.line( os['dss']['x'],os['dsd']['y'],os['dss']['x'],os['dss']['y'] )
00444             ## Pat-mat grandparents
00445             canv.line( os['sds']['x'],os['sdd']['y'],os['sds']['x'],os['sds']['y'] )
00446             ## Pat-pat grandparents
00447             canv.line( os['sss']['x'],os['ssd']['y'],os['sss']['x'],os['sss']['y'] )
00448             # Make sure we draw the page to the canvas when we've
00449             # finished with it.
00450             canv.drawText(tx)
00451             canv.showPage()
00452         canv.save()
00453         return 1
00454     except:
00455         logging.error('Unable to fetch the pedigree for animal %s in pyp_reports/pdf3GenPed()!',animalID)
00456         return 0
00457 
00458 ###############################################################################
00459 # _pdfDrawPageFrame() was taken from the procedure drawPageFrame() included in
00460 # the demo program odyssey.py in the ReportLab distribution.  _pdfInitialize()
00461 # is rolled together using some of the code in odyssey.py as an example, as
00462 # well as some of my own work.
00463 ###############################################################################
00464 
00465 ##
00466 # _pdfInitialize() returns a dictionary of metadata that is used for report
00467 # generation.
00468 # @param pedobj A PyPedal pedigree object.
00469 # @retval A dictionary of metadata that is used for report generation.
00470 def _pdfInitialize(pedobj):
00471     """
00472     _pdfInitialize() returns a dictionary of metadata that is used for report
00473     generation.
00474     """
00475     _pdfSettings = {}
00476     _pdfSettings['_pdfTitle'] = pedobj.kw['pedname']
00477     _pdfSettings['_pdfPageinfo'] = pedobj.kw['filetag']
00478     # Calculate margins, etc.
00479     _pdfCalcs = {}
00480     if pedobj.kw['default_unit'] == 'inch':
00481         _pdfCalcs['_unit'] = inch
00482     else:
00483         _pdfCalcs['_unit'] = cm
00484     if pedobj.kw['paper_size'] == 'letter':
00485         _pdfCalcs['_page'] = letter
00486         _pdfCalcs['_top_margin'] = letter[1] - inch
00487         _pdfCalcs['_bottom_margin'] = inch
00488         _pdfCalcs['_left_margin'] = inch
00489         _pdfCalcs['_right_margin'] = letter[0] - inch
00490         _pdfCalcs['_frame_width'] = _pdfCalcs['_right_margin'] - _pdfCalcs['_left_margin']
00491         _pdfCalcs['_frame_height'] = _pdfCalcs['_top_margin'] - _pdfCalcs['_bottom_margin']
00492         _pdfCalcs['_page_width'] = letter[0]
00493         _pdfCalcs['_page_height'] = letter[1]
00494     else:
00495         _pdfCalcs['_page'] = A4
00496         _pdfCalcs['_top_margin'] = A4[1] - inch
00497         _pdfCalcs['_bottom_margin'] = inch
00498         _pdfCalcs['_left_margin'] = inch
00499         _pdfCalcs['_right_margin'] = A4[0] - inch
00500         _pdfCalcs['_frame_width'] = _pdfCalcs['_right_margin'] - _pdfCalcs['_left_margin']
00501         _pdfCalcs['_frame_height'] = _pdfCalcs['_top_margin'] - _pdfCalcs['_bottom_margin']
00502         _pdfCalcs['_page_width'] = A4[0]
00503         _pdfCalcs['_page_height'] = A4[1]
00504     _pdfSettings['_pdfCalcs'] = _pdfCalcs
00505     return _pdfSettings
00506 
00507 ##
00508 # _pdfDrawPageFrame() nicely frames page contents and includes the
00509 # document title in a header and the page number in a footer.
00510 # @param canv An instance of a ReportLab Canvas object.
00511 # @param _pdfSettings An options dictionary created by _pdfInitialize().
00512 # @retval None
00513 def _pdfDrawPageFrame(canv, _pdfSettings):
00514     """
00515     _pdfDrawPageFrame() nicely frames page contents and includes the
00516     document title in a header and the page number in a footer.
00517     """
00518     # Write the report title in the top, left-hand corner of the page.
00519     canv.line(_pdfSettings['_pdfCalcs']['_left_margin'],
00520         _pdfSettings['_pdfCalcs']['_top_margin'],
00521         _pdfSettings['_pdfCalcs']['_right_margin'],
00522         _pdfSettings['_pdfCalcs']['_top_margin'])
00523     canv.setFont('Times-Italic', 12)
00524     canv.drawString(_pdfSettings['_pdfCalcs']['_left_margin'],
00525         _pdfSettings['_pdfCalcs']['_top_margin'] + 2,
00526         _pdfSettings['_pdfTitle'])
00527 
00528     # Write the date/time in the top, right-hand corner of the page.
00529     canv.line(_pdfSettings['_pdfCalcs']['_left_margin'],
00530         _pdfSettings['_pdfCalcs']['_top_margin'],
00531         _pdfSettings['_pdfCalcs']['_right_margin'],
00532         _pdfSettings['_pdfCalcs']['_top_margin'])
00533     canv.setFont('Times-Italic', 12)
00534     canv.drawString(_pdfSettings['_pdfCalcs']['_right_margin'] - \
00535         1.85 * _pdfSettings['_pdfCalcs']['_unit'],
00536         _pdfSettings['_pdfCalcs']['_top_margin'] + 2,
00537         pyp_utils.pyp_nice_time())
00538 
00539     # Write the page number bottom center.
00540     canv.line(_pdfSettings['_pdfCalcs']['_left_margin'],
00541         _pdfSettings['_pdfCalcs']['_top_margin'],
00542         _pdfSettings['_pdfCalcs']['_right_margin'],
00543         _pdfSettings['_pdfCalcs']['_top_margin'])
00544     canv.line(_pdfSettings['_pdfCalcs']['_left_margin'],
00545         _pdfSettings['_pdfCalcs']['_bottom_margin'],
00546         _pdfSettings['_pdfCalcs']['_right_margin'],
00547         _pdfSettings['_pdfCalcs']['_bottom_margin'])
00548     canv.drawCentredString(0.5 * _pdfSettings['_pdfCalcs']['_page'][0],
00549         0.5 * _pdfSettings['_pdfCalcs']['_unit'],
00550         "Page %d" % canv.getPageNumber())
00551 
00552 ##
00553 # _pdfCreateTitlePage() adds a title page to a ReportLab canvas object.
00554 # @param canv An instance of a ReportLab Canvas object.
00555 # @param _pdfSettings An options dictionary created by _pdfInitialize().
00556 # @param reporttitle Title of report; if '', _pdfTitle is used.
00557 # @param reportauthor Author/preparer of report.
00558 # @retval None
00559 def _pdfCreateTitlePage(canv, _pdfSettings, reporttitle = '', reportauthor = ''):
00560     """
00561     _pdfCreateTitlePage() adds a title page to a ReportLab canvas object.
00562     """
00563     import textwrap
00564     _pdfDrawPageFrame(canv, _pdfSettings)
00565     # _title_y is the y-coordinate at which a given line of the title should be
00566     # printed.  It is defined here because both the title and the author renderers
00567     # need to see it.
00568     _title_y = 7 * _pdfSettings['_pdfCalcs']['_unit']
00569     canv.setFont("Times-Bold", 36)
00570     if reporttitle == '':
00571         canv.drawCentredString(0.5 * _pdfSettings['_pdfCalcs']['_page'][0],
00572             7 * _pdfSettings['_pdfCalcs']['_unit'], _pdfSettings['_pdfTitle'])
00573     else:
00574         # This is potentially confusing, so here goes: we're going to split
00575         # the title on '\n's and write each resulting bit of text on its own
00576         # line.  drawCentredString() does not automatically do this so I had
00577         # to hack it on.
00578         _bits = string.split(reporttitle, '\n')
00579         for _b in _bits:
00580             # Based strictly on observation we need to wrap titles longer than 26
00581             # characters when using the default 36-point typeface.
00582             if len(_b) > 26:
00583                 _b_wrapped = textwrap.wrap(_b, 26, break_long_words=True)
00584 #                 print _b_wrapped
00585                 for _bw in _b_wrapped:
00586                     canv.drawCentredString( 0.5 * _pdfSettings['_pdfCalcs']['_page'][0], \
00587                         _title_y, _bw)
00588                     _title_y = _title_y - 1 * _pdfSettings['_pdfCalcs']['_unit']
00589             else:
00590                 canv.drawCentredString( 0.5 * _pdfSettings['_pdfCalcs']['_page'][0], _title_y, _b)
00591                 _title_y = _title_y - 1 * _pdfSettings['_pdfCalcs']['_unit']
00592     # Only print the author's name if there is one.  A report is not required to have an
00593     # author.
00594     if reportauthor != '':
00595         canv.setFont("Times-Bold", 18)
00596         canv.drawCentredString(0.5 * _pdfSettings['_pdfCalcs']['_page'][0],
00597             _title_y, reportauthor)
00598     canv.showPage()
